tossupQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following accounts for the largest increase in 
cancer death rate in the USA between the years 1900 and 1990: 
 
W) lung 
X) breast 
Y) colon 
Z) stomach
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice The structure of DNA proposed by Watson and Crick was 
partly based on the x-ray work of: 
 
W) Louis Pasteur 
X) Rosalind Franklin 
Y) Linus Pauling 
Z) Eleonore Rubinstein
bonusA: X) ROSALIND FRANKLIN

tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice If light is passed through two pin holes and the 
patterns allowed to overlap on a wall, the pattern produced by the intersection of waves is called: 
 
W) an intersection pattern 
X) an interference pattern 
Y) an arcing pattern 
Z) a construction pattern
bonusQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer Add a second proton and two neutrons to the 
hydrogen nucleus and you have which element?
bonusA:
HELIUM (ACCEPT: He) 
Junior National Science Bowl Round Robin 6 Page 1

tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice To guard against sparks causing a fire, mechanics 
aboard submarines during World War II often used tools made from which of the following: 
 
W) chrome plated steel 
X) vanadium 
Y) cold rolled steel 
Z) bronze
bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice The shape of galaxies, stars, planets and their 
orbits is mostly attributed to: 
 
w) light 
x) matter 
y) electricity 
z) gravity
bonusA: Z) GRAVITY

bonusQ:
3 ½ hours 
X) 7 hours 
Y) 5 hours 
Z) 4 ½ days
bonusA:
X) 7 HOURS

tossupQ:
MATH Multiple Choice The longest straight line that can be drawn inside a circle is called 
its: 
 
W) radius 
X) vector 
Y) tangent 
Z) diameter
bonusQ:
MATH Short Answer If you walk north for 3 miles along 1st street and make a 90 degree 
right turn east onto B street and then walk for another 4 miles what would be the shortest 
distance back to where you started, if you could walk in a straight line?
bonusA:
5 MILES 
 
(Solution : 3, 4, 5 right triangle)

tossupQ:
EARTH SCIENCE  Multiple Choice If air masses move toward mountains from the west, 
most of the moisture will fall on the 
 
W) north side of the mountains 
X) south side of the mountains 
Y) west side of the mountains 
Z) east side of the mountains
tossupA: Y) WEST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS
bonusQ:
EARTH SCIENCE Short Answer Order the following periods of geological time from oldest 
to youngest: Jurassic, Cambrian, Triassic,
bonusA:
CAMBRIAN; TRIASSIC; JURASSIC

Earth?
bonusQ:

an atomic mass of 12.01, how many protons and neutrons are in the nucleus?
bonusA: 6 PROTONS, 6 NEUTRONS

of the 5 Kingdoms are Animalia, Plantae, Fungi, and Protista. What is the fifth?
bonusQ:

heart:
bonusA:
LEFT VENTRICLE, RIGHT VENTRICLE, LEFT ATRIUM, RIGHT ATRIUM 
(ACCEPT IN ANY ORDER)

tossupQ:
EARTH SCIENCE Multiple Choice What happened in 1815 to cause that year to be named

X) a large volcano erupted 
Y) there was a radical shift in the jet-stream southward 
Z) several large earthquakes occurred simultaneously around the globe
bonusQ:
EARTH SCIENCE Multiple Choice When, in the geologic column, did dinosaurs become 
extinct? 
 
W) at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary 
X) at the Jurassic-Cretaceous boundary 
Y) at the Triassic-Jurassic boundary 
Z) at the Permian-Triassic boundary
bonusA:
W) AT THE CRETACEOUS-TERTIARY BOUNDARY
